waitingManufacturer.empty: All manufacturer packs sent. Nothing blocked.

posNotAmazonReady.empty: All POs are ready for Amazon

shipmentsInTransit.empty: All shipments delivered. Everything up to date.
shipmentsInTransit.tableNotExists: Shipment tracking is not configured yet

stickyNotes.title: Notes
stickyNotes.confirmDelete: Do you want to delete this note?
stickyNotes.empty: No notes. Click "Add" to create one.
stickyNotes.projectRequired: You must select a project to create the task

errors.notAllowed: You don't have permission to perform this action

profitability.title: Profitability
profitability.long: The profitability calculator helps you determine if a product is viable to sell on Amazon. Enter expected costs and revenues to get the margin and decision (GO, RISKY, NO-GO).

selling_price.title: Selling Price
selling_price.short: Price at which you will sell the product on Amazon
selling_price.long: The selling price is the final price that the customer will pay for the product on Amazon. This price must include all costs and your desired profit.

cogs.title: COGS (Cost of Goods Sold)
cogs.long: COGS includes the unit cost of the product at the factory, excluding shipping and other costs. It's the price you pay the supplier per unit.

shipping_per_unit.title: Shipping per unit
shipping_per_unit.short: Shipping cost from factory to Amazon
shipping_per_unit.long: Shipping cost per unit from the factory to Amazon's warehouse (FBA). Includes international transport, customs, and handling.

referral_fee_percent.title: Referral Fee
referral_fee_percent.long: Amazon charges a referral fee on each sale. This percentage varies by product category (usually between 8% and 15%).

fba_fee_per_unit.title: FBA Fee per unit
fba_fee_per_unit.long: Amazon charges an FBA (Fulfillment by Amazon) fee per unit that includes storage, picking, packing, and shipping to the end customer.

ppc_per_unit.title: PPC per unit
ppc_per_unit.long: Average advertising cost (Pay-Per-Click) per unit sold. Calculate total advertising cost divided by number of units sold.

other_costs_per_unit.title: Other costs per unit
other_costs_per_unit.long: Any other variable cost per unit, such as custom packaging, labels, quality inspections, etc.

fixed_costs.title: Fixed Costs
fixed_costs.long: Fixed costs that are only paid once, such as product photography, listing creation, brand registration, etc. They are divided among all units sold.

margin.title: Margin
margin.long: Margin is the profit percentage you get over the selling price after subtracting all costs. A margin above 25% is considered good.

roi.title: ROI (Return on Investment)
roi.long: ROI indicates how much profit per euro invested. An ROI above 2.0 means you earn more than double what you invest.
roi.example: Ex: ROI of 2.5 means €2.50 profit for every €1 invested

amazon_ready.title: Amazon Ready
amazon_ready.short: Configuration to send products to Amazon
amazon_ready.long: The Amazon Ready section contains all the information needed to send products to Amazon FBA warehouses. Make sure all fields are completed before generating the Manufacturer Pack.

fnsku.title: FNSKU
fnsku.short: Amazon's unique code for the product
fnsku.long: FNSKU (Fulfillment Network Stock Keeping Unit) is a unique code that Amazon assigns to your product. It's needed to generate the labels that must be stuck on each unit.

gtin.title: GTIN
gtin.long: GTIN (Global Trade Item Number) is a unique barcode that identifies the product globally. It can be an EAN-13 (Europe) or UPC (United States).

units_per_carton.title: Units per carton
units_per_carton.short: Number of units that fit in a carton
units_per_carton.long: Number of individual units packed in each carton. This information is needed to generate carton labels and calculate space needed on the pallet.

cartons_per_pallet.title: Cartons per pallet
cartons_per_pallet.short: Number of cartons that fit on a pallet
cartons_per_pallet.long: Number of cartons that can be stacked on a standard pallet. This helps calculate space needed in the warehouse and optimize shipments.

purchase_orders.title: Purchase Orders
purchase_orders.long: Purchase orders (PO) are documents that formalize the purchase of products from suppliers. Here you can manage the entire lifecycle of orders, from creation to receipt.

po_number.title: PO Number
po_number.long: The PO number is a unique identifier automatically generated for each purchase order. It's used to reference the order in communications with suppliers and for tracking.

status.title: Order Status
status.long: Order status indicates which phase it's in: confirmed (confirmed), waiting_manufacturer (waiting for manufacturing), in_transit (in transit), received (received), etc.

tracking_number.title: Tracking Number
tracking_number.long: The tracking number allows you to track the shipment from the factory to the warehouse. Enter the code provided by the shipping company.

eta_date.title: Estimated Arrival Date
eta_date.long: The estimated arrival date (ETA) is the expected date when the shipment will arrive at Amazon's warehouse or your warehouse. Helps plan receipt and product launch.

research.title: Research Phase
research.long: The research phase is the first stage of the project, where you evaluate product viability. Here you capture product information, analyze competition, and make the initial decision (GO, RISKY, DISCARDED).

asin.title: Amazon ASIN
asin.long: ASIN (Amazon Standard Identification Number) is a unique 10-character identifier that Amazon assigns to each product. You can get it from the product URL on Amazon or enter it directly.

supplier_quotes.title: Supplier Quotes
supplier_quotes.short: Comparison of prices from different suppliers
supplier_quotes.long: Supplier quotes allow you to compare offers from different suppliers for the same product. You can add multiple quotes and compare prices, MOQ (Minimum Order Quantity), and conditions.

decision.title: Decision
decision.long: The decision indicates if the product is viable: GO (viable, continue), RISKY (viable but with risk), DISCARDED (not viable, discard). This decision is based on profitability and competition analysis.

finances.title: Finances
finances.long: The finances section allows you to record and manage all expenses and income related to your projects. You can create custom categories, view balance, and generate reports.

expenses.title: Expenses
expenses.long: Expenses include all costs related to projects: purchase orders, samples, advertising, tools, etc. You can assign them to a specific project or leave them global.

incomes.title: Income
incomes.long: Income is all the money you receive from product sales on Amazon. You can assign it to a specific project for detailed profitability tracking.

categories.title: Categories
categories.long: Categories allow you to organize your expenses and income. You can create custom categories like 'Advertising', 'Samples', 'Tools', etc., for better financial control.

recurring_expenses.title: Recurring Expenses
recurring_expenses.long: Recurring expenses are expenses that are automatically generated each month or period (such as subscriptions, rents, etc.). The system generates them automatically according to the configuration.

dashboard.title: Dashboard
dashboard.short: Overview of all projects and activities
dashboard.long: The dashboard is the main page where you see an overview of all your projects, orders, tasks, and activities. You can customize the widgets that are displayed to adapt it to your needs.

widgets.title: Widgets
widgets.long: Widgets are elements displayed on the dashboard to provide quick information. You can enable or disable widgets and reorganize them according to your preferences.

sticky_notes.title: Sticky Notes
sticky_notes.long: Sticky notes allow you to create quick reminders. They can be global or associated with a specific project. You can convert them to tasks when necessary.

tasks.title: Tasks
tasks.long: Tasks help you track pending actions. They can be associated with a specific project or be global. You can assign priority and due date.

settings.title: Settings
settings.nameAndImageRequired: Name and signature image are required

gtinPool.description: Manage available EAN/UPC codes to assign to projects

projects.codesAutoGenerated: Codes are generated automatically. The SKU will be used to identify the product on Amazon and in orders.
projects.driveFolderWillBeCreated: The folder "{{sku}}" will be created in Google Drive automatically
projects.connectDriveToCreateFolders: Connect Google Drive to create folders automatically
